required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Egg Protein Hydrolysate and Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Egg Protein Hydrolysate on Arterial Stiffness in Overweight or Moderately Obese Subjects With Impaired Glucose Tolerance or Diabetes Type 2

brief_summary.textblock:
The incidence of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is rapidly growing. Patients with T2DM are at increased risk of developing long term micro- and macrovascular complications. Subjects with impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) show increased blood glucose levels after an oral glucose load. These subjects have a markedly increased risk of later T2DM development.
T2DM development can be prevented or delayed by lifestyle modifications. To support lifestyle changes and reduce the risk of T2DM development, foods containing functional ingredients are being developed. An interesting functional ingredient is protein hydrolysate. An egg protein hydrolysate has been experimentally shown to improve endothelial function, to inhibit plasma angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) and to reduce blood pressure in rats. Egg protein hydrolysate could thus be a interesting ingredient to treat the cardiovascular dysfunction associated with T2DM. In the present study, the effects of egg protein hydrolysate will be evaluated in subjects with overweight or moderate obesity and IGT or T2DM.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The change (baseline vs 2 hours, and baseline vs 2 days) in arterial stiffness measured as carotid-femoral pulse wave velocity
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline vs 2 hours, baseline vs 2 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in glucose and insulin concentrations and calculated HOMA-index, incretins, lipids, characteristics of the microcirculation, and non-invasively assessed upper-arm blood pressure and central aortic systolic blood pressure and heart rate changes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline vs 2 hours, and baseline vs 2 days

arm_group.description: Once in the study, 20 subjects will be randomly assigned to a group taking capsules containing 5 gr egg protein hydrolysate per day, and 20 to a group taking placebo capsules. The subjects consume the capsules during three consecutive days (period 1). Following a wash-out period of minimally four weeks, the treatments are crossed-over.

intervention.intervention_name: protein hydrolysate capsules and placebo capsules
intervention.description: Once in the study, 20 subjects will be randomly assigned to a group taking capsules containing 5 gr egg protein hydrolysate per day, and 20 to a group taking placebo capsules. The subjects consume the capsules during three consecutive days (period 1). Following a wash-out period of minimally four weeks, the treatments are crossed-over.
